Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: MarieJM84
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and staff are friendly. The hotel is very close to an underground station so if you are wanting to sight see this is useful. However I felt the hotel was a little too far out of the way from the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: Mikey8700
Reviews.Content: Just about what you would expect for a mediocre hotel. Really nice rooms, friendly staff. As always in Berlin the hotel breakfast is somewhat pricy - 15 euro. And we missed a fridge in our rooms. Wifi is 12 euro for 24 hours... All in all okay...

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,value for money,a bit away from the city center.”
Reviews.Author: elpinikipearl
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for 3 nights.The hotel was wonderful, modern, just like it was described on the internet, nothing misleading, no extra charges. The room was quite modern, warm and clean, although a bit small. If you are a smoker, note that smoking rooms are on 4th floor and the air in them is also clean. That's something that smokers do appreciate.Excellent breakfast,rich and tasteful,friendly stuff, if you don't speak german, they all do speak very good english,really value for money.The location around the hotel is nice ,kind of "posh", makes you feel secure, we were never afraid even though we were coming back to the hotel late at night (about 03 or 04 o'clock) You should also note that there's no room service at all. And no fridge, but we didn't mind. Now, the location. It's true that the metro stop is about 50 m away, but the hotel is not close to many attractions. It took us about 1 hour to berlinermauer. It's about 30 minutes to Alexanderplatz, where you usually change metro line or S-bahn (the connections are well-served and fast and you can buy tickets to the reception without extra charge) but it's close to other stuff, such as the zoo,which is great, the german opera, KaWeDe, so I guess it depends on what you want to see. From my experience, there are too many sites all around the city, so wherever you choose to stay, you'll have something close to you and something away. If I would stay again?Of course, and if you book early, there are excellent deals.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, but far away from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: nemakili
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff. The room was modern with all the facilities. Breakfast was very good in a very pleasant large room. Location is kind of far away from the main sights, and lonely , especially during the night, but we always felt safe. Since we usually came back to hotel late at night , (10 to 11pm ) we always opted to take a taxi from the Alexander Platz,( very cheap ) which is the nearby place about 5 minutes in car or a good 30 minutes walking. If you enjoy walking, and spend the day as any other citizen from this city, we did walk from the hotel to the Brandenburg Gate and it is highly recommended. Wear conferrable shoes, believe me this is a long walk, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin”
Reviews.Author: travellersub
Reviews.Content: Very close to the underground station, just a few steps. Breakfast was good with good variety, but less staff so you had to wait for coffee. Free internet in the lobby and room was cleaned very well every day. Deffinetley a place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria E
Reviews.Content: Very nice position - 2 mins walk from the subway station. The position is not very central - not located in the Mitte, but it's shortly reachable. The rooms are confortable with a nice design. Breakfast is various and very good, with fresh local products. There's also a free internet station in the lobby and complementary travel items (toothpaste and toothbrush). Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Requires improvement in customer service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust81000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Leonardo for 3 very cold nights in winter. We had booked a double room through an agency and we were instead given a twin bedroom with the beds joined together. When I called reception they said that they were fully booked and could only change it the next day - of course there was no mention of this during check-in. The rooms were too hot, they clearly have a problem with their heating - if you set the temperature at 21 degrees, it heats up the room to well over 24+ degrees and then you actually have to open the windows to regulate the temperature. Additionally, the rooms were quite small. The customer service wasn't the best - the staff were generally quite gruff. They don't really give you any help with local tourist information, so you're pretty much on your own. The only positive was that the breakfast spread was one of the best I've seen. I have stayed at a range of star hotels but they really had a great hot breakfast at Leonardo and the service here was quite prompt. Last but not the least, the Wi-fi service here is a total rip-off. If they think customers will pay 12 Euros per day for internet, they must be delusional. Definitely a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ashutosh1109
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel in Berlin. Specially given the good location and connectivity to metro rail. Overall staff attitude and a grand resturaunt makes it a good experience. The room size is however small and you need to pay for wi-fi connectivity. But Internet and printer facility in the lobby covers it up. All in all very good hotel and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, well situated, friedly staff”
Reviews.Author: Benira
Reviews.Content: The Hotel, in the center of west Berlin. Rooms are quiet and the breakfast is very rich and tasty

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anakbabiilang
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights alone. It is located in a nice quiet area, within walking distance to the subway station with connection to all places around Berlin. The receptionist was not very welcoming, but that's a minor thing. Internet connection is ridiculously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: d b
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights and we had a great stay.The room had 5 star standards,apart from a mini fridge,to keep your water cold. The location is convinient and the metro station is just 100m from the hotel. In less than 3minutes walk is the Opera and a very nice italian cosy restaurant is Don Giovani (krumme str.74/next to the opera),very good prices,atmosphere and flexible to create the pasta you like.There are 2 Don Giovani (not the one that the hotel recommends). In total,very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy”
Reviews.Author: axio99
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel doesn't look that impressive but the room is excellent. It looks so new even though it is already 2 years old. Carpet is thick and soft and you can walk around barefooted. We were given a junior suite as we were triple sharing. Main bed is a huge king size and the foldout is from the leather sofa bed which itself is a queen size at least, mattress doesn't look thick but because the bottom has good springs, the bed is very comfortable. Room is big and comfortable and bathroom is modern. Only gripe will be there is no bathroom door so since we are 3 in a room, 2 had to really sit near the door so they won't see whoever is in the shower (if they sit watching the tv from the seating area, they can catch the reflection in the mirrors). Love the many windows in the room although we don't open it because our room look down into the garbage area but there is a small church behind our hotel and one can hear the bell chime at night. Hotel restaurant is classy and since we were there on Xmas eve, we were presented with chocolates and also champagne (yes, for breakfast). Lobby is small but has large art deco like lamps that makes the lobby bright. Hotel entrance is too small though. Hotel is a 15-20 mins walk to the nearest shopping mall even though there is a good size supermarket just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: SGlobe_trotter
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on hotels.com for this hotel. Was in Berlin for a conference at ICC. Hotel was just a really short distance away from the metro station, and the ICC was easily accessible by the metro (if memory serves me right, it is only about two or three metro stations away). I had no problem arriving on time for the morning conference sessions. Breakfast was not included in the hotel price. But that was not a problem as there are some cafes around. There is also a supermarket round the corner from the hotel which sells a great variety of things at very reasonable prices. I bought a one liter bottle of mineral water for 0.50 euro! For the price I paid, I really wasn't expecting a lot from hotel Leonardo. But I was in for a pleasant surprise. The hotel rooms are spacious and the bathroom was huge. The bed was really comfortable too. I noticed that there are a lot of emergency push buttons in the room (one next to the bed, two in the bathroom). I don't know why there are so many of them in the room though. There are also grip bars installed in the shower and WC area, probably for safety as well. One night, I pressed the emergency button by mistake as I was looking for the light switch, and some one called the room soon after that to make sure I was okay. So the buttons do work... Wifi is not included in room charge. Service at check in and check out was adequate. Overall, a good for value hotel conveniently located next to bahn station.

Reviews.Title: “A modern accomodation”
Reviews.Author: YiorgosFinn
Reviews.Content: I spent overall 6 nights at Leonardo Hotel in Berlin with my wife and it was quite relaxing and decent. Good points: Helpful and polite staff, value for money, modern large comfortable rooms with large windows for more daylight from outside, only a few meters from Bismarckstrasse U-bahn station, nice relatively quite neighborhood with plenty of shops, super markets, restaurants and fast foods. Minor bad points: no refrigerator at the room, free but slow inconvenient internet access at the living-room next to reception area, very expensive breakfast rates(10-15 euros per person) for those that have booked accomodation without breakfast. Some tips: 1. Book only accomodation without breakfast to be included. You save a lot of money compared to the small nice cafes nearby that provide everything for a delicious breakfast with only 3-5 euros! including coffee or tea. 2. If you wish to visit Bundestag (German Parliament building) and especially its glass-made dome (it is worthwile) you have to prior register online at least 2-3 days before the day you plan to visit it, since it is a way to firstly screen your details, to see how many and at what time to expect their visitors 3. Issue an unlimited transportation card for the days you are going to stay in Berlin since you will definitely need it. U- and S-Bahn is very useful to get you around. I definetely recommend this hotel for your stay whilst in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and good located”
Reviews.Author: tamerlano77
Reviews.Content: Rated as a 3 star it's new and recently constructed hotel located near the Deutsche Oper. Connected by the rest of the town with metro U2 line (Bismarkstrasse), its interior is modern, rooms are nice and comfortable, with air conditioning, TV, safetycase, wireless internet, telephone, shower and hairdriver in the bathroom. The service is excellent, you can rent a bike and a breakfast is served on the 1th floor restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A REASONABLE Stay For The Price”
Reviews.Author: JR-KIKI
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute as a surprise trip with my finacé - mid October. Hotel was very easy to find and is a two minute walk away from BismarckstraBe, we stayed from the Monday to the Friday. Don't expect a grand frontage or imposing location, the entrance is just a set of double doors like a shop front along a very unassuming side street. The reception area has a very minimalist 21st century feel to it. Reception was prompt, decent and of course for Berlin full English was spoken, despite my best efforts of broken German. We were allocated room 527 which we weren't too happy with as this was adjacent to the main elevators but thought we would give it a go. Room was spacious and modern with the customary flat screen TV although English channels were VERY limited. I think there were only 2 or 3 which were all the international news channels. We have previously stayed in Berlin and the hotel room offered a decent choice, so this was very disappointing, although we weren't in Town to watch TV, it is nice to catch up and put your feet up. The room didn't have a bath which was a disappointment and the toilet bowl a very odd design. Without going into too much detail the bowl was very shallow and didn't seem overly hygenic. Otherwise the large walk in shower was hot and powerful and everything else worked well. For one of the nights I didn't sleep well with the clacking of the elevator weights being very faintly heard, my partner also had a couple of iffy nights - this was more down to the room location than a fault of the hotel itself, I'm sure most of the other rooms were fine. There was quite a bit of construction work going on around the area too which often started quite early. The view from the room was average rather than exceptional. My advice would be do NOT buy any drinks from reception, these were around 2-3 Euros for a small drink - around the corner there is a supermarket which sells drinks for a much more reasonable charge, so prepare in advance. The restaurant looked clean and there is a small bar adjacent to the main reception although we didn't try this out. The location is very good for the West end shopping of K'Damm and there is another large shopping centre two blocks south of the hotel which has all your high street brands. Like anywhere located in the CBD of Berlin, transport is excellent so getting anywhere is pretty academic and for most well known locations takes no more than 30 minutes. I only paid around £50 a night which is pretty cheap for Berlin - so I would say the hotel represents fair value for money but if you want to make the stay special spend a little more and go elsewhere. Have previously stayed at the Hotel Berlin twice and I would say little details made that superior for the extra money. Happy Travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: OasisAtlantico
Reviews.Content: Liked the rooms - very spacious, and loved the breakfast. Only 2 things weren`t good - the cleaning and the employees in the reception (too arrogant and rude).

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Monalisa777
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is comfortable and modern. The bathroom was very small with a very small wash area & shower. The location is amazing. shops & restaurants & coffee shops right outside the hotel. the hotel also has 2 free computers with interness access down in the lobby for quick use. The train station Bismark Strasse U-Bahn is right there as well. Just a block away is a wide range of shopping & eating options near the Wilmersdorfer shopping arcade!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Messe Conference Centre”
Reviews.Author: Brightonian
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this Hotel which is very comfortable and close to Bizmark Strasse U-Barn. My deal which I booked some weeks in advance included free wifi and breakfast. I had some spare time and even hired a bike which was a great way to see Berlin with little time. Lots of Cycle paths! Hotel rooms modern clean, good choice of international channels on the TV. Breakfast very good

Reviews.Title: “To be highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon D
Reviews.Content: My expectations of this hotel were exceeded. The location is good, both in terms of it being close to the 109 bus route from Tegel and very close to U Bahn and bus stops to the centre of Berlin. ALL staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful. The room was clean, adequate for our needs and well serviced daily. It was also quiet at night, allowing for a good night's sleep which is often not the case in city hotels. Breakfast was excellent. I would certainly choose to stay here again and have no reservations in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel full value for the money”
Reviews.Author: izu41
Reviews.Content: nice, exellent breakfast, STAFF very helpful,many restaurants,cofee shops in the surround

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klingenberg
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were travelling with her work mates and their spouses and stayed three nights in this rather new hotel. The room (544) was very nice, not spaceous, but quite adequate. The service was good and the breakfast included something for everyone -- a very good starter for the day. Beds were done and towels changed daily. Located almost at the end of the shopping quarter of Wilmersdorf Street (Straße) there are very good shops and restaurants in most categories all around and a few minutes walk takes you to very good shopping malls including C&A, H&M and more expensive shops too. The new Opera is some 10 min. walk away, and the Underground only some two to three minutes away (next corner from the hotel). Those who like extra size meals would like to cross the street at the entrance where you find an excellent restaurant offering XXL meals at a very modest price. :-) For a three star hotel, what you get here is more than most of the competition offers, I think. Very good for spending the nights and getting the odd rest between events, and this is how our trip was. If you, OTOH, want to spend most of your day at a hotel, I would choose a more spaceous 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: Agx
Reviews.Content: I spent few nights at hotel Leonardo in Berlin in April 2011. Hotel was small and clean. Room was modest but worth it's price. Hotel was located wery near to a subway station so it was easy to go all over Berlin from there. Breakfast was not included and one morning we bought breakfast which was good, tasty and had lots of varietys but was also very expencive (15 euros per person). Almost opposite the hotel was a small cafeteria where you can get a nice breakfast for few euros. Also, around the corner is Berlin Opera house which offers a nice sunday brunch with live jazz band and it costs also only around 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, but not perfect either”
Reviews.Author: Jules_et_Jim
Reviews.Content: The room layout was a bit deceptive. When you first come in, it looks like an average-sized room but after a couple of minutes inside, with your suitcases open, then you realise that it is effectively smaller than it appeared. The trick is the size of the bed: you assume is a regular one but in fact is narrower. The lack of separation between the sleeping room and the bathroom means that if you had to go during the night, when you switch the toilet lamp on, you light up the whole room and disturb your partner’s sleep. Neither of the above should be a problem if you travel solo, but that was not our case. We had a similar experience with the hotel’s car park. After getting the ticket on the barrier, we had access to a parking lot where only two spaces where free, and we soon discovered why: there were too small even for a compact car. So if you plan to get to the Leonardo on car, our advice is: 1) don’t assume that there will be a place waiting for you, because the car park is quite small for such a big hotel; 2) if you drive a large car or a SUV, consider an alternative. In conclusion, we left the Leonardo with a mixed sensation: it could have been a very good choice for a solo traveller that gets there on taxi or public transport. But if you plan to share the room, and if you contemplate a long stay, the standard twin room may feel a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “nice confortable and very good price”
Reviews.Author: karina-alina
Reviews.Content: the best part of our europe trip was the city of berlin and this hotel. was everything we've expected at a good price. very confortable bed, clean, quiet area. also very close to 2 metro stations [20min to city center] in an area with a lot of cafes, restaurants and shopping sites. the only dezadvantage i could say was the high price wifi in the room [the 2 computers in the lobby were always busy with kids playing]. but not missed so much as the city compensate :) we will definetelly return to berlin and leonardo hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too expensive Wi Fi”
Reviews.Author: NikolStar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend. We booked a room on very good conditions (some nice and cheap rate) the wi fi was too expensive (so we didn't use it) all the rest was fine. Specially the bed - it was great! I recommend this hotel to come, the location is also nice.

Reviews.Title: “An excelent value for money,good location very clean”
Reviews.Author: unejour
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends just came back from Berlin, all was great and the hotel Leonardo was one of the many reasons we enjoyed our holidays. We were given rooms in the back of the hotel with connecting doors, no noise touring the night, very nice and soft beds. The hotel is very nice decorated next to metro station, easy access from Tegel airport if you take the 109 bus, very clean hotel, the stuff was so polite and ready to help at anytime! the breakfast was also very good it keeped our tummies full till late afternoon. They stored our luggage’s till late without charge on the day we were leaving and also called a taxi to the airport for us. Many thanxs to the stuff of the hotel, if we ever go back to Berlin we will definitely stay at Leonardo hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Linta9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Leonardo hotel in June 2011 for 3 nights. The staff was nice and helpful. They all also spoke English. The reception was quick and friendly. When we arrived in hotel at 9 a.m. we checked-in immediately. Hotel is situated perfectly there are plenty of café and pedestrian area with shops in walking distance. It is only a short walk to the U-Bahn (U2, U7) which go to all major tourist attractions. The bus 109 to Tegal airport is less than 5 min walk from hotel. We were given room 327, which was close by elevator, but sound isolation was excellent. The room was clean with air conditioning, wi-fi internet, safety box and tea/coffee facilities. The buffet breakfast was included and was delicious. Definitely recommend this hotel and you will not be disappointed if you stay here We would stay again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly efficient comfortable hotel near Charlottenberg and the Opera”
Reviews.Author: lilywall
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable 3 day stay in this nice modern hotel. It is in a relatively quite street close to the Bismarckstrasse U Bahn. Our room, one kitted out for diabled use as it happens, was spacious and comfortable with facilities for making tea and a room safe. The shower room was large and good to use. Our bed was large and comofortable with individual quilts which we liked. The breakfast was good - we would recommend the view on the street rather than the car partk. It was easy to eat healthily - fresh fruit, low fat yoghourt, diet jams and delicious small croissants for the tempted. Helpful and cheerful staff made this a very pleasant stay. We loved being able to walk home from the nearby Deische Oper.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, good location, nice breakfast, value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Steven D
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Leonardo for a week. the girlfriend had a conference at ICC, which was only two U-bahn stops away, and we visited the whole city during the whole week, (well, I was alone until Wednesday), but the location is fantastic with good connections to U-and S-Bahn routes that get you to everywhere in Berlin. the hotel itself was clean, the room ( a special needs room althoug we didn't need one) was spacious and clean. the breakfast was very nice and varied, even for staying a week. in short very good 3-star hotel good value for money (we booked via booking.com)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_Lon
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, well designed and stylish. Rooms modern, functional and comfortable. Location was bit out oft he way for us, long walk to Kudamm and Nollendorfplatz. Had a nice champagne evening in the bar which we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “A good combination of price, service and location”
Reviews.Author: DanyaV
Reviews.Content: Advantages: 1) nice modern design of the rooms 2) comfortable bed 3) located in a quite district near the underground station. A lot of cafes and restraunts are located nearby 4) staff is friendly Disadvantages: 1) no wi-fi. Two PCs are located at the ground floor but they are always occupated and besides they work really slow 2) in our room we had openspace with wash-bowl and transparent shower cabin. You might not like this if you're shy Overall impression: is good for students or young couples.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, cozy, comfortable and located conveniently near transport”
Reviews.Author: Deepaliandvivek
Reviews.Content: The Leonardo is a great hotel with adequate rooms and all necessary amenities. Their restaurant had a great buffet and the staff were very friendly. There are numerous shops and restaurants nearby and the hotel itself is near the underground and bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: HelenaSLondon
Reviews.Content: Don't expect anything remotely like customer service here. We had decorators on our floor after requesting a quiet room, cleaning staff were vacuuming next door at 7.30am in the morning and when I complained I was met with shocking aggression from reception staff. On the morning of our checking out while having breakfast, we were approached by a staff member who demanded we pay him in cash for our breakfast as we were checking out that day. I refused saying I would pay my total bill on checking out and he was furious, raised his voice and was very aggressive!! I wrote a two formal letters of complaint to the head office and did not receive a reply. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the location”
Reviews.Author: realtraveltips
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin to experience the famous Christmas Markets and found soo much more. The room was a good size with a very comfortable bed and large bathroom with shower. The large windows provided great views. The only downside was no refridgerator in the room and no ice machine. I had a room with a good view of the street ( Wilmserfer strase). This effected my sleep because of the noise of the street and people speaking loudy while walking down the mildly busy street. I stayed at this hotel because it was a package deal with my airline. I was pleasently surprised by how close the hotel was to the U-Bahn (Berlins underground train). The Bismarkstrass U-Bahn station was only steps away from the hotel. The U-Bahn goes directly to Alexanderplatz, Potdommerplatz, Zoogarden, and many more. There was a small christmas market, many shops, resturants, and a shopping mall on the street. The hotel was very good at conserving energy. Unaware of this when I booked my travel, I found myself in my hotel room trying to figure out how to turn my lights on. It only took me half an hour but I managed. All the lights will not work in the room unless the room key card is inserted into a slot near the door. When you leave the room, you have to take your key therefor turning out the lights. I would certainly stay at this hotel again. I have videos and pics of this hotel and my stay in Berlin on my youtube account. (iheat2travel) If you need more info please let me know, I love talking about travel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect effective and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: 10 miutes by taxi from Tegel airport, quiet neighborhood with all necessary shops and small restaurants. Practical and stylish design. Stylish breakfast restaurant with perfect choice of food. Few stops with tube to central Berlin, and to the citys conference venue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Neil-OWEN
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to start. The front desk staff are superb, rooms clean and comfortable,and the buffet breakfast excellent. We went for a three night stay to Berlin and this hotel was a pleasure to stay in.Less than 200 yards from the underground, near to a variety of shops and very reasonably priced restaurants, and two small points that make such a difference, free internet and free coffee in the foyer, the latter most welcome when returning from outside temperatures that are constantly below freezing. As a certain film star said "WE WILL BE BACK"

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to tube & Tegel airport”
Reviews.Author: RichKatie
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at Leonardo hotel was good. We stayed the first week in December and it was -10* outside but the hotel was warm & aircon in the room warmed up quickly. Our room was one where the bathroom opened onto the bedroom but this wasn't too much of a problem. We did have dirty glasses in our room ond day but they were quickly replaced by reception who were very apologetic the hotel has a tube link just around the corner which is perfect and we tried 3 hotels in the area all of which were good, la spiga Italian turn right out of the hotel then right again and it at the next crossing on the opposite side of the rd, then there was violin galerie opposite the hotel which was good for cheap and cheerful local food then there was a traditional resturant serving amazing local food out of the hotel & left then right onto the main street, cross the rd and 2 streets up, very resonably priced and so much food we were no where near finishing!! The 109 bus picks up around the corner (hotel reception will give you directions) it's only a 15min ride to the airport and only cost €2.10 per person!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: brazturk
Reviews.Content: New hotel, good location (1 block from subway). Room very clean but no frigobar.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but my stay was ruined by a very bad staff member”
Reviews.Author: Nalini65
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel but ok for business purposes However one incident ruined my stay. I was asked to come down to the reception and asked rudely if I was smoking in my room!! I am incidentally a non smoker and this was insulting to me at so many levels , being questioned and treated like a schoolgirl . I am widely travelled and have stayed at both big and small hotels but have never encountered such insolent questioning and would never stay in any Leonardo or group hotel again as satff training is terribly inadequate

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mohalloran7
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel were very positive. The exterior and lobby are immaculately clean, and the receptionist was very smiley and welcoming. We asked her to recommend some places to eat and she immediately opened up a map and circled a few places, giving us directions too! Our room was great, clean crisp sheets and look recently refurbished. The bathroom has the nicest power shower, I wanted to take it home!! We stayed Room Only so sadly did not try any of the food at this hotel, the prices were a little much, and we ate out in the city most nights. If you're on a tight budget meal-wise, turn right when you come out of the hotel and across the road - there is a cute Spanish family run restaurant where you can get a meal for 5 euros! (and it's yummy, I promise!) The only downside to this hotel is the location - it's a good 10-15 minute walk to Alexsander Platz and about 20-30 mins to the Reichstag. BUT on our second night, we found out that there was a bus stop directly across the road from the hotel, and the bus runs regularly into Berlin proper. You can buy day long tickets from the reception - well worth it unless you want achy feet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: timknit_10
Reviews.Content: Easy to find hotel when arriving at Schoenefeld airport because it is close to a U bahn station, which is on the same line as the nearest U Bahn to the airport. The reception staff were very freindly and helpful for directions to places of interest. The hotel is situated in a quiet but well accessed area of Berlin and quite close to a main shopping area. The rooms are modern and well appointed with a great power shower, but the beds are bit too soft for our liking. However the breakfast is fantastic and considering the hotel was quite busy service was prompt and the buffet breakfast never ran out of anything or looked sad and uninviting. Quite the opposite it takes real strength of will not ot overeat it so appetising. We both thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: alexian30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 night on September 2010. 3++ brand new facilities, the room quite big and modern designed. bathroom is also huge. No minibar and no bath. Not centrally located but just few steps from the metro station of two main lines. Breakfast is very good with a lot of tasty stuff. Service is excellent and very friendly staff. Free internet access at the lobby, but always busy. have to wait! It was enjoyable stay! I will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: knitting1984
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Clean, friendly staff, great location, free internet in the lobby, modern decor and my favourite part was there amazing breakfast. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff and hidden costs.”
Reviews.Author: BarbTMFp
Reviews.Content: Positives: Very good breakfast, yummy fresh produce shop across the street, very close to U-Bahn stop, many shops and restaurants within a couple blocks. Hotel is close to big shopping district and Schloss Charlottenburg. Very friendly and helpful staff. We accidently left something in our hotel room and it was returned to us in the US quite quickly: just over 2 weeks. Negatives: Parking ramp was additional charge, as was in room internet: charged per computer/device! There were computers for the guests in the lobby, but those were just about always in use (only saw them available in the wee morning hours), often with a waiting line.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kathy47714
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near a pedestrian area with shops and a mall. Supermarket next door is open until 10 p.m. all days except Sunday. You must travel by public transport to visit any attractions or trendy bars and restaurants, but no problem since the subway station is so close. Two things could use improvement: would be nice to have at least one English-language TV news channel available and they could reduce the time limit for the free PCs in the lobby to minimize waiting since they are in such high demand (11 euros per day for WiFi in the room is a bit steep).

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, new hotel in popular area close to amenities and transport.”
Reviews.Author: DP2K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. New decor & modern rooms with a/c, tv, safe & power shower. Located very near 2 tube stations, shops & amenities. Walking distance to some tourist attractions (Charlottenburg) & taxis to city very reasonable. Staff were great and the price was exceptional for the quality & service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: laurens22
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Berlin for 3 nights after 4 days in Munich last fall. In Berlin, we stayed at the new Leonardo Hotel and were very impressed. The hotel was clean, nicely decorated, with comfortable beds and a friendly staff. The employees were very helpful and accommodating. We decided to pay for the full breakfast buffet on the last day, and it was delicious with a wide selection. We had a great stay at Leonardo and would recommend it to anyone looking to spend a few nice nights in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “THE hotel for the Deutsche Oper”
Reviews.Author: Alsacienne
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location - three minutes on foot (level ground) - as we had tickets for a concert and an opera at the Deutsche Oper. But I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Berlin who wants comfort and cleanliness at a very reasonable price. The hotel is only one block's walk from the bus stop on the corner of the Kaiser-Friedrich-Strasse and the Bismarckstrasse which is directly served by the 109 bus from Tegel airport. The area is calm, with a few local restaurants, including a good Italian and a good German opposite the hotel's entrance, which is not actually on the Wilmersdorferstrasse itself but round the corner on the Spielhagenstrasse. The hotel is only 300 meters if that from the Bismarkstrasse U-Bahn which is only three stops from Berlin Zoo, and which has a direct S-Bahn link to the Hauptbahnhof (Central Station). You can buy picnic ingredients locally, and the Rogacki delicatessen and stehcafé (standing up café) is just opposite the hotel. The hotel's bar is open in the evening, and the Brazilian bartender is friendly and efficient. I pointed out to the check-in staff that comments had been made about some of the bathrooms leading directly into the bed part of the bedroom rather than being off the entrance part of the room. If you want to have your bathroom 'separate' from the main sleeping area, please mention this to reception when booking and they will make sure that you get a room in this style. The bed was very comfy and the duvet light but warm. My 6th floor room was very quiet and there were 3 lifts so you didn't have to wait a long time before one arrived. The room was cleaned efficiently everyday, although the chambermaid was quite keen to start early - 8 am! The breakfast buffet was delicious, generous and fresh. Waiting staff were quick to remove crockery and cutlery that had been finished with, and to replenish the food. The free internet facility in the lobby was very useful, especially as you could use a printer directly ... checking in for a return flight was a breeze! It's a large hotel, and we noticed several tour groups during our stay. However, the hotel was not noisy, and the infrastructure was well suited to processing large groups very quickly. We found the secure baggage room very useful as we had a late evening departure, and appreciated the fact that valuable items such as laptops were locked away securely in a different location - the manager's office - and identifying numbered labels helped you get your items back very quickly. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and coped with many different languages. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin who is not using a particular brand of hotel for 'points' earning or redemption. It is clean, safe, new and welcoming, and I fully intend to return there if I have reason to visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: daveur
Reviews.Content: I atayed at this hotel when coming for the ITB tourism show at the MesseBerlin. The hotel is perfectly located close to Bosmark Avenue, short distance from the KuDam and nightlife and 3 stops by Uban or a very short taxi ride from the MesseBerlin. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful and the combined atmosphere of a new hotel is great especially in Europe

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Deutsche Oper”
Reviews.Author: Ramond
Reviews.Content: We came to a snowy freezing Berlin for 5 consecutive Wagner operas at the Deutsche Oper. With sidewalks icy and slippery, the hotel's location was unbeatable - just a 5 minute walk from the Opera. The first room we got was unsatisfactory - not too well cleaned, and with the shower cubicle opening directly into the room - little privacy. The next morning they moved us to a better room with a conventional en suite setup and this was a great improvement. The breakfasts were excellent: great variety, hot scrambled eggs, and good service. Front desk was not over-friendly (but I could see they were very busy). Rates however were really reasonable, and we are going back again for a further Wagner (Ring) cycle at the end of April. In the end the location near the Oper won us over, besides which the local shopping is excellent. However, for most of he main sights and the galleries etc. on the East you need to use the very convenient subway, or take quite inexpensive taxis.

Reviews.Title: “A good, reasonably priced, hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryHotspur98
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with friends for a long weekend. Its a nice modern.hotel. The best bit was the excellent breakfasts which were included in the room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Fine base for city exploring”
Reviews.Author: BruceyNBFC
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the perfect base for a city break on a budget then the Leonardo Hotel is the perfect place to stay. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of Berlin's main attractions including the Zoo and the Kaiser Willhelm Memorial Church, although the less physically inclined tourist will be pleased to note that Bismarckstrasse underground stop is yards away and runs directly to Schoenfeld airport, as well as notable tourist stops such as Alexanderplatz, Potsdamer Platz and the Olympiastadion. It also benefits from being close to a vast array of shops on Wilmersdorfer Strasse including the newly built shopping centre. Not that this means that the hotel suffers anything in the way of noise pollution; far from it. Berlin is one of the calmer cities I've visited. The hotel itself is modern, and welcoming. We checked in at gone midnight and still found the staff friendly and efficient. The room was more than we were expecting with a comfortable and spacious bed being an extremely welcome discovery at that time of night. Further inspection in the morning showed a smart shower room and compact but clean sink area and seperate toilet. Always handy in the mornings to be able to maximise your time. We didn't sample the food at the Leonardo, put off perhaps by the price of the breakfast, however on a city break, you're never going to struggle to find somewhere to get refuelled, so please don't let that put you off. What the Leonardo does offer is a fine base to see Berlin. Quite, safe, smart and comfortable, the hotel comes highly recommended by myself and my partner, and we shall be looking to use this brands hotels in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “warm and confy”
Reviews.Author: RoxanaE
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was really close to the center of the city, too bad we were too busy to go and check it out. The night the sleep was story like, the beds were made even for living there not just sleeping. Again too bad we had to wake up at early hours. The food was very divversified and nice. My suggestion to all hotels is to make weekly summary of events and best places to visit...cause even on business trip you can check out some local places. Also the TV had no automatic shut down option...i like to fall asleep with the tv turned on:) 100% satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nash0819
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap base for the weekend before I re-located to the slightly more upmarket hotel that my work had booked for me, as I was in town to attend a conference the following week. This one was relatively close to the other hotel and had reasonable reviews on here so I went for a cheap deal on hotels.com at about £35 per night. The bus from Tegel airport stops one block down from the U-bahn stop and the hotel is a further 30 seconds walk down a side street. With a heavy case, the walk was about 5 minutes in all, once I had got my bearings. The hotel looks a bit old-fashioned from the outside but the interior is much more modern-looking. The staff were efficient, helpful and spoke good English. My single room was quite small but more than acceptable by European standards, with modern decor. The comfortable bed had those irritating square pillows that the Germans insist on using. I did ask at reception if they had any English-style ones but they only had the sausage dog variety, which are even worse in my opinion. I guess you get used to them after a while, the Germans must do! As noted below, the bathroom area is part of the main room, with only the shower unit and separate toilet areas enclosed, but I was on my own and this did not bother me. A very large TV dominates one wall and had HDMI inputs, should you be carrying any such devices. During my stay, one of the two free internet terminals was broken and the other was almost permanently in use, with one person hogging it in particular, which the hotel staff didn't seem bothered about. I paid for internet access in my room for one night and it worked fine. I ate at the restaurant opposite on one of my two nights and it seemed to serve genuine local food. It won't be winning any prizes but it was pleasent enough fare. I could not find any decent breakfast places nearby and ended up munching on a croissant or two before heading into the city. Overall pretty good, apart from the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “By Default”
Reviews.Author: Yogmart
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Leonardo Berlin. We had decided on the Leonardo Royal(Four *) but the company we booked through booked us at this Hotel (Three *) by mistake. The Hotel was just okay. It was not very clean as some previous comments have said. The doors (Bathroom and Wardrobe) in the room were full of grubby hand prints and looked like they had never been cleaned. The breakfast was not too good either with cheapo cereals and Scrambled eggs that were un-edible. On the plus side the Reception area had free Internet access computers and a Printer attached to them which was also free. This is a great thing in a hotel and enabled us to print of Maps of where we were going and Internet flight Check-ins. Its location is good too with direct access to U-bahn BISMARKTSTRASSE and Wilmersdorferstrasse just around the corner and super markets close by. December is a great time to head to this fabulous City which has a large selection of Christmas Markets in a place that already has so much to offer. I would highly recommend Berlin as a city break but I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pharmaas
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights during our long weekend trip. Hotel is located in a quiet but interesting part of Charlottenburg, only 15 mins walk to the Palace. U-Bahn station Bismarckstraße is on the same block, as well as restaurants and stores. Hotel is brand new, clean and neat. Rooms were fairly spacious with LCD screen. Rooms have internet connection, though a pay service. But there are 2 PC's with internet for free in the lobby. Service was typical Berlin style, efficient and polite. Breakfast was excellent with lots of choices, I recommend the French bread. I have stayed in tourist hotels in cities all over Europe, but this one beats them all in terms of price vs quality. 5 out of 5 on the tourist hotel scale. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings - but hotel in it self overall good”
Reviews.Author: sannah_swe
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings. This is overall a nice hotel as they opened in august this year. The hotel is located 30 sec from U-bahn BISMARKTSTRASSE and Wilmersdorferstrasse. You cant miss it. Its not the funniest location, but it is so close with u-bahn and if you want to save some money do it by taking the u-bahn 10 min in to the real city life. On arrival the person at the reception desk did not even notice us, I had so speak up to get attention (and yes we are over 18 and well dressed). We got our room on a high floor, the person at the desk did not say much. The Room ++++ The good part is that it is new = fresh! A flat screen TV, a good twin bed and a closet and safe. The Room ------ The shower is outside the toilet wich could be good but the lightening system is the same. So if you go up in the middle of the night to go to the toilet you wake up your partner as you turn on full lights just to go to the bathroom. Also you should not be shy to the person you are traveling with as the shower is right in front of the bed and you practically have to get out naked in front of the other person to get your towel. Pillows in bed - probably one of the worst I have slept on ever. If you are picky - bring your own! Barstaff - Wanted to borrow a glass of icecubes to our white wine in the room. The man asked me if I had 2 Euro. I said as you se sir, i did not even bring my keycard to the room. He ignored me some minutes then said again. " - So how would you like to do"? I answeded i could just go up, pour out the ice and go back right away. He said its not possible, because how could he know I would not STEAL the glass. This made me reaky pissed off so I gave him my private jewellery just to give him something. The glass was from Ikea and worth 0,50 cent. To me this was very dissapointing, as this musut be one of the most common questions in a hotel. Overall - Hotel and room itself - good. Staff - Many things to work on!!!! I would still reccomned it though, if you dont want a hotel where you can chat with the staff and care mre bout room/good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Basic Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smurf77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Leonardo Hotel while attending a conference at The International Congress Centrum Berlin (ICC Berlin). The hotel is just around the corner from the Metro station and the ICC is two stops and a short walk away, so it is close enough without having to pay too much. The Metro is also on one of the main lines that will take you directly into the central tourist areas. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. Rooms had a TV (all in German though) and air-conditioning. No fridge or iron, but you could pay for the laundry service which was a bit expensive. Wireless Internet is available for a cost of about 11 Euros for 24 hours. The bathroom had a nice shower and a decent hairdryer and was clean. Check-in is no earlier than 3pm (especially in busy times), but they do have a luggage room for storage until you get to your room. The breakfast was excellent consisting of the usual tea, coffee, breads, jams, eggs, sausages, muesli, yogurt, cheeses, cold meats and salad. The waiting staff, however, were a bit slow and more interested in clearing up than serving most of the time. The reception desk was always busy and although polite, the staff were not very knowledgeable about the area. I also had problems getting internet access on occasions because the hotel was fully booked and they had run out of internet codes, something I have never experienced before, so get yours early! Overall a good hotel, but staff could use a bit more training and they need to address their internet usage capacity problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mel071
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from one of our many trips to Berlin. We stay somewhere else each time and this time we decided to try this new hotel. We enjoyed our stay, there was nothing major worth complaining about. The only minor point I would mention is that we found the pillows too big and soft. The location is fine and easy to reach. Rooms are clean, shower was fine. We didn't try the breakfast as we find that hotel breakfasts in Berlin, although often good, are twice as expensive as the wonderful breakfasts you can get at Berlins many cafés. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dori-DD
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this hotel and I think we got a very good deal. The hotel is not located in Central Berlin but the metro is a just 1 or 2 mins walk and it has a supermarket and cafes closeby. also the same metro line also goes to other major attractions so the location was not a major problem. thought the rooms were a bit small, it was really comfy and as it was newly built it was very clean. we had gone on a europe tour and I think out of all the hotels we stayed in, the service in this hotel was the most impersonal. we never actually talked to the staff and neither did they. we did not have hot water for 2 days out of our 4 day stay in the hotel. when my husband complained on the last day of our stay, they said as a compensation, they would offer us free breakfast buffet which i thought was a good offer.. however, they had offered us free wifi services when we booked the hotel. however, when we enquired about this during our stay they said that we had to pay for it and it was quite expensive. this was one of the downside of staying at this hotel. overall I think I would stay in this hotel again. it was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value if you pre book well in advance”
Reviews.Author: sriramhary
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for this hotel on hotels.com - 60 Euros per night without breakfast and it was a real bargain. We stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel was opened only on 1st August so everything in the room was relatively new and contemporary. Beds are comfortable and the furnishing is modern. Although they advertise of free Wi-Fi, we found out that we have to pay for it and it is quite expensive. On our last day, the hot water was not working and when we complained of it, they apologized and said they are experiencing some difficulties with their water system and instead provided us with free breakfast, which had a very good choice. The hotel is situated close to various cafes and a big super market. There is also a big shopping arcade close to the hotel. Although it is a bit far from the main attractions, there is a metro 100 meters from the hotel. So that’s was not a problem at all. For the price we paid it was a real value and we would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clueless and untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: KaiserWilheim
Reviews.Content: The staff appeared untrained and clueless. We paid for a 2 bed non-smoking junior suite, but got a 1 bed smoking one instead. The staff were partronising and smirked to each other when we asked for our original requirement. We were downgraded with no refund to a small cramped room with a dirty towel in the bathroom. Obvious items such as cups, shower gel and details of hotel facilities were missing from guests' rooms. Breakfast was haphazard - staff stood around aimlessly and blatently moaned to each other if customers asked then to do anything such as refill the empty juice machines or bring coffee.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronit11
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. Very comfortable, clean, good breakfast, very close to the metro. The only problem was : the door of the shower is open diretly into the room. Therefor, you must get out nacked (or with a towl).
